assessments.task_description:
This component requires a 10 minute in-class oral presentation in German, to be written up as a 250-word written summary (also in German) after the presentation. Both the presentation and the summary are to focus on one poem by Goethe only. In the oral part of the presentation, you may refer to notes, but do not merely read them out aloud.

Your presentation (and the subsequent write-up of the presentation) should answer directly the four questions that appear below:

  1. Wann hat Goethe dieses Gedicht geschrieben?
  2. Wo/wann/in welchem Umfeld/Kontext spielt das Gedicht?
  3. Was thematisiert das Gedicht?
  4. Was möchte der Dichter mit dem Gedicht sagen?

The 10 minute presentation is to be completed in class between WEEK 3 and WEEK 5. Students may present a maximum of 10 powerpoint slides during the presentation.

250 word summary in German is to be submitted no later than 5 pm on September 3, 2025 and is to be submitted via Turnitin. No bibliography is required, but a brief list of references may be included if you have referred to one or more secondary readings in your presentation.

The grading criteria for the presentation and summary can be found in the attachment GRMN3330 Presentation Write-Up Rubric.

Sign up for your presentation in class after consulting the lecturer.

AI and MT Statement

For the oral, in-person component, the use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

assessments.task_description:
The exam will be conducted in-class in WEEK 9 and will last up to 90 minutes.

What is involved? The exam will have two parts. The first part of the exam will focus on questions relating to the narrative plot. These questions are to be answered in German. The second part of the exam will focus on questions of interpretation. Students may answer this part of the exam in English or German.

No bibliography for this task is required.

assessments.task_description:
A research essay of 2000 words (excluding the bibliography) to be written in either German or English requires you to discuss and critique in-depth the topics covered during weeks 10-13 of the course in relation to Kleist's story Das Erdbeben in Chili. Questions will be made available by week 11. The essay is due on November 21, 2025 at 5 pm. In the research essay you are asked to demonstrate the capacity to marshal a wide-ranging argument and to explain it competently to a critical reader. Formal conventions governing the presentation of an academic essay are of value in this assessment task. Students are to use MLA style and to take account of the criteria below.

The essay should be submitted via Blackboard.
